android.smartcard
Class SmartcardClient

java.lang.Object
  android.smartcard.SmartcardClient

public class SmartcardClient
extends java.lang.Object

Adapter class to be used by clients of the smartcard service.

Encapsulates smartcard service binding and unbinding and provides a higher level proxy for the smartcard interface.
When done using the smartcard adapter, call the shutdown() method to release the acquired smartcard channel.

Nested Class Summary
static interface SmartcardClient.ISmartcardConnectionListener
          Interface definition of smartcard listener to be informed about smartcard service connect and disconnect events.

Constructor Detail

SmartcardClient

public SmartcardClient(Context context,
                       SmartcardClient.ISmartcardConnectionListener listener)
Constructs a new smartcard adapter to be used by clients.

Note that connecting to the smartcard service is an asynchronous operation. Clients should specify a listener during construction of this instance to be informed on completion of the connect operation.

Parameters:
context - the context (activity) which connects to the smartcard service. Must not be null.
listener - a listener to be informed about smartcard service connect and disconnect events. May be null.
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - the client does not have the permission to bind the smartcard service.
Method Detail

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Disconnect from the smartcard service and release all acquired smartcard channels. It is recommended to call this method in the onDestroy() method of the activity.

getReaders

public java.lang.String[] getReaders()
                              throws android.smartcard.CardException
Returns the friendly names of available smart card readers.

Returns:
a list of available readers
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the smartcard service not connected to.
android.smartcard.CardException - if a communication error with the smartcard service occurred.

isCardPresent

public boolean isCardPresent(java.lang.String reader)
                      throws android.smartcard.CardException
Returns true if a smartcard is present in the specified reader.

Parameters:
reader - the friendly name of the reader to be checked for card presence.
Returns:
true if a smartcard is present false if a smartcard is absent
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the reader name is null.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the smartcard service is not connected.
android.smartcard.CardException - if a communication error with the smartcard service occurred.

openBasicChannel

public ICardChannel openBasicChannel(java.lang.String reader)
                              throws android.smartcard.CardException
Opens a basic channel to the card in the specified reader.

Note that not all smartcards support communication on the basic channel. E.g. the USIM card is already occupied by the GSM modem so only logical channels can be used for communication.

Parameters:
reader - the friendly name of the reader to be connected.
Returns:
a basic channel to the card in the specified reader.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the reader name is null.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the smartcard service is not connected.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the reader name is unknown.
AccessControlException - if the access control conditions are not fullfilled.
android.smartcard.CardException - if opening the basic channel failed.

openBasicChannel

public ICardChannel openBasicChannel(java.lang.String reader,
                                     byte[] aid)
                              throws android.smartcard.CardException
Opens a basic channel to the card in the specified reader and selects the applet with the specified AID.

Note that not all smartcards support communication on the basic channel. E.g. the USIM card is already occupied by the GSM modem so only logical channels can be used for communication.

Parameters:
reader - the friendly name of the reader to be connected.
aid - the AID of the applet to be selected. Can be omitted by empty value or null: Then no selection will be performed (same as openBasicChannel(String reader) ).
Returns:
a basic channel to the card in the specified reader.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the reader name or aid are null.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the smartcard service is not connected.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the reader name is unknown or the AID length is illegal.
AccessControlException - if the access control conditions are not fullfilled.
android.smartcard.CardException - if applet selection failed.

openLogicalChannel

public ICardChannel openLogicalChannel(java.lang.String reader,
                                       byte[] aid)
                                throws android.smartcard.CardException
Opens a new logical channel to the card in the specified reader and selects the applet with the specified AID.

Parameters:
reader - the friendly name of the reader to be connected.
aid - the AID of the applet to be selected.
Returns:
a new logical channel to the card in the specified reader.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the reader name or aid are null.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the smartcard service is not connected.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the reader name is unknown or the AID length is illegal.
AccessControlException - if the access control conditions are not fullfilled.
android.smartcard.CardException - if opening the logical channel or applet selection failed.
